top_comment.text:
although I agree with the message that people should not blindly follow the 
world, but as a passionate engineering student, I sometimes feel the 
media(referring to this video) downplay the importance of science, and more 
importantly the message of downplaying such a essential formula F=ma, I do 
not think it's healthy for the community.﻿
top_comment.author: damujklas

comments.text: LOL the rocket needs the formula F=ma
comments.author: Mrlocoroco222

comments.text: +Jia Yu Lin I am also in healthcare. :-)
comments.author: Kiddy Sirius

comments.text:
+damujklas "Imagination is more important than knowledge" was quoted from 
Albert Einstein. 
Read the quote again. This quote doesn't imply knowledge is useless. 
The truth is people will see what they want to see. That's you too.
comments.author: Kiddy Sirius

comments.text:
To me, this mv is more displaying "follow your dreams and do what you want 
to do, not what others want you to do." I don't see it as downplaying 
science. To me, every major is important, not just science. Science is 
great but it's also important to understand that other majors are important 
too because it helps us become a more well-rounded person. I feel as though 
some parents force their children to go for something just because of 
status. I think it's important to like what you do and follow your dreams, 
not just doing something because of status or because others think that's 
what you should be doing. It also mentions that just because you are doing 
something with your life, it shouldn't stop you from your hobbies or the 
things you like to do. Overall, we shouldn't mold or fix ourselves to be 
something just because people want us to be that way. We should want to be 
that way and be ourselves, not just follow the media or whatever the rest 
of the world wants. Life is short, by the time you feel regretful about not 
doing something you have always wanted to do, you won't be able to do it 
anymore so might as well just live your life to it's fullest. Maybe I 
missed it, but I don't see how they are downplaying science in here… F=ma 
is an important formula but it took a whole lot of imagination to get 
there. Also, it took a whole lot of passion for someone to come up with 
that formula. Without that person following their dreams and thinking 
something out of the ordinary, F=ma would cease to exist. Anyways, thanks 
Newton! Love this video though…Mayday is awesome! I can really relate to 
this. All these years my parents and family pushed me to be in healthcare, 
now looking back, I wonder if I just did it for the status…or because my 
parents made me…or because I actually like it lol I guess I will find out 
in the future.
comments.author: Jia Yu Lin

comments.text:
Analyze and interpret the message from media is important. As what you 
said, it would be great if people are able to appreciate it. Unfortunately, 
people nowadays just blindly follow the message from media :(
comments.author: Eu Ching Yi

comments.text:
+damujklas Yes that is true. We must constantly analyze the real reasons 
and meanings behind all forms of media (magazines, newspapers, online 
videos etc) and the information presented to us, instead of taking them at 
face value.
comments.author: Hyperion1965

comments.text:
+Hyperion1965 Actually if people would appreciate the implications behind 
this video, then it would be great. But problem with media is, much of it 
are taken literally where people take the idea of disliking science and 
math, more than the idea of "pursuing one's dream"
comments.author: damujklas

comments.text:
+Kiddy Sirius However your imagination can not be realized without proper 
knowledge, you can't design an airplane without knowing F=ma. SImilarly, 
knowing F=ma doesn't mean you can design an airplane.
comments.author: damujklas

comments.text:
"Imagination is more important than knowledge."
Passion and Imagination led to the discovery of F=ma.
 All great discoveries are not because of memorizing of formulas,
but acting on passion and imagination.
comments.author: Kiddy Sirius

comments.text:
Yes, i think you're right in saying that science is important. It is 
important to contemplate on science and the acquisition of knowledge for 
humankind. I think in fact modern society does support and perpetuate the 
trend of using and applying science - albeit mainly for economic gains and 
profits. Many of the major technological breakthroughs of the recent years 
depend largely on science and engineering - without them we would not have 
new tools in biomedical science, information technology, electrical systems 
etc. The negative aspect is that science and engineering has been largely 
geared towards profit motives in the recent years, rather than for the 
pursuit of knowledge. Inventions are made more for their marketability to 
customers instead of how they can help humanity improve as a whole 
(especially when thinking about luxury items like the smartphone and 
flatscreen tvs) Science should be for the acquirement of objective 
observations of nature (although objectiveness itself is hard to determine 
too) and (maybe) on improving human lives and the environment in a positive 
way. 

In fact this MV itself also argues for the importance of allowing children 
to pursue their interests, even if it is in science (the girl was clearly 
interested in studying physics and rocket science, but was forced to study 
medicine, probably because being a surgeon is more profitable than studying 
rockets). The formula F=ma (and its repetition on the board) was probably 
to show how rote learning has destroyed the passion for learning in 
children, focusing only on teaching them how to get good grades in exams. 
Perhaps the downplaying of the formula was not to downplay science but 
rather to criticize the suffocation of the human learning spirit by the 
capitalist machinery.
comments.author: Hyperion1965

captions.text: Just a little kid, staring with a mouth wide open
the very first fool.
Just a little wish, thinking about going to school soon.
Can I, can I, mom?
There will be lots of teachers, classmates, new backpacks and books,
,and the very first handkerchief.
Who would have thought all the best years would be used up?
But who can break from this path?
Growing up isn’t about playing, drawing, or time in the sandbox.
Growing up is learning calligraphy, addition, and subtraction.
It’s hard to tell if he’s a fool, you’re a fool, I'm a fool, or who’s a fool.
Fool or not, time continues chasing us down.
In the end, in the blink of an eye we’re old, in the blink of an eye our hair is grey,
in the blink of an eye times and places change.
All a fool can do is keep marching forward.
Not allowed to fall in love. Just this serious was he,
the second fool which appeared.
Adults tell him not to be afraid, for love and youth
await him in the future.
o he tossed aside poems, innocence, winter and summer vacation,
comics and guitar.
He finally cried. That day, when the Royal Poinciana bloomed for the last time,
memories were missing.
If the world is flat, then why does everyone climb upwards?
In life you’re either a winner or a loser. Do you dare lose?
It’s hard to tell if he’s a fool, you’re a fool, I'm a fool, or who’s a fool.
Fool or not, time continues chasing us down.
In the end, in the blink of an eye we’re old, in the blink of an eye our hair is grey,
in the blink of an eye times and places change.
Fools continue to struggle.
Which formula will allow me to discover
this broken answer?
Which sentence pattern will allow me to express
the grammar of sadness?
19 years later, all I have is five certificates
and half a future.
I finally realize I am the first, second,
and third fool.
Is this a familiar story? Have you been here with your heart broken?
Fool or not, the price paid is incomparable.
In the end, in the blink of an eye we’re old, in the blink of an eye our hair is grey,
in the blink of an eye the years explode with our tears.
Only three sad fools left behind.
All that’s left to do is turn up the volume.

title: Mayday五月天[三個傻瓜Three fools]官方Official HD MV
